terms.definition: Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and track modifications
A chronological record of system activities and changes that provides evidence of what actions were performed, when, and by whom
A centralized location where all authoritative and up-to-date information is stored, eliminating conflicting or duplicate data across systems
An international standard that specifies requirements for quality management systems to help organizations ensure consistent product and service quality
Good Manufacturing Practices - a set of guidelines that ensure products are consistently produced and controlled according to quality standards
Food and Drug Administration - a U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating and supervising the safety of food, drugs, medical devices, and other consumer products
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization
Manufacturing Execution System - software that connects and monitors machines and work centers on the factory floor to track production in real-time
A security method that restricts system access and permissions based on a user's role within an organization
A deviation from specified requirements, standards, or procedures that indicates a product or process does not meet quality criteria
A documented strategy that outlines steps to address and prevent the recurrence of identified problems or non-conformances
Work groups composed of members from different departments or areas of expertise who collaborate to achieve common goals
